SlotKeyCollection.summary: Represents a collection of instances associated with a .
SlotKeyCollection.remarks: The /c> class provides a collection of SlotKey instances that are associated with a . This collection allows you to enumerate and work with the keys present in the .

SKCCtor.summary: Initializes a new instance of the /c> class with a reference to the parent .
SKCCtor.param: The to which this collection is associated.
SKCCtor.remarks: Use this constructor to create a new /c> that is associated with a specific . The parameter represents the parent to which this collection is linked.

SKCCount.summary: Gets the number of elements in the /c>.
SKCCount.remarks: This count corresponds to the number of keys associated with the that this collection belongs to.

SKCContains.summary: Determines whether the /c> contains a specific .
SKCContains.param: The to locate in the collection.
SKCContains.remarks: Use this method to check whether the /c> contains a specific SlotKey instance.
SKCContains.returns: if the /c> contains the specified ; otherwise, .

SKCCopyTo.summary: Copies the elements of the /c> to an array, starting at the specified index.
SKCCopyTo.param: The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the /c>. Must not be null.
The zero-based index in at which copying begins.
SKCCopyTo.remarks: The CopyTo method copies the elements of the /c> to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index in the destination array. The destination array must have enough space to accommodate the elements to be copied.
SKCCopyTo.exception: Thrown if is negative, greater than or equal to the length of , or if there are not enough elements in the /c> to fill the destination array starting at the specified index.

SKCEnumerator.remarks: The Enumerator struct allows you to enumerate the SlotKey instances in the . Use this enumerator to iterate over the keys in the collection.

SlotValueCollection.summary: Represents a collection of values associated with a .
SlotValueCollection.remarks: The /c> class provides a collection of values that are associated with a . This collection allows you to enumerate and work with the values present in the .

SVCCtor.summary: Initializes a new instance of the /c> class associated with a .
SVCCtor.param: The with which this collection is associated. Must not be null.
SVCCtor.remarks: The constructor initializes a new instance of the /c> class that is associated with a specific . The parameter determines the with which this collection is associated.

SVCCount.summary: Gets the number of values in the /c>.
SVCCount.remarks: This count corresponds to the number of values associated with the that this collection belongs to.

SVCContains.summary: Determines whether the /c> contains a specific value.
SVCContains.param: The value to locate in the collection.
SVCContains.remarks: Use this method to check whether the /c> contains a specific value.
SVCContains.returns: if the /c> contains the specified value; otherwise, .

SVCCopyTo.summary: Copies the elements of the /c> to an array, starting at the specified index.
SVCCopyTo.param: The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the /c>. Must not be null.
The zero-based index in at which copying begins.
SVCCopyTo.remarks: The CopyTo method copies the elements of the /c> to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index in the destination array. The destination array must have enough space to accommodate the elements to be copied.
SVCCopyTo.exception: Thrown if is negative, greater than or equal to the length of , or if there are not enough elements in the /c> to fill the destination array starting at the specified index.

SVCEnumerator.summary: Represents an enumerator for the values in the /c>.
SVCEnumerator.remarks: The Enumerator struct allows you to enumerate the values stored in the . Use this enumerator to iterate over the values in the collection.
